# Code Review Template

**Template for standardizing code review documentation**

---

## Code Review Checklist

**Reviewer:** `Reviewer Name`  
**Date:** `YYYY-MM-DD`  
**PR/Issue:** `#123`  
**Author:** `Author Name`

## Review Categories

### Functionality

- [ ] Code works as intended
- [ ] Edge cases are handled
- [ ] Error handling is appropriate
- [ ] No breaking changes (or documented)
- [ ] Tests pass

### Code Quality

- [ ] Code follows style guidelines
- [ ] Code is readable and maintainable
- [ ] No code duplication
- [ ] Appropriate use of design patterns
- [ ] Comments are clear and helpful

### Performance

- [ ] No performance regressions
- [ ] Efficient algorithms/data structures
- [ ] Database queries are optimized
- [ ] Caching is used appropriately

### Security

- [ ] No security vulnerabilities
- [ ] Input validation is present
- [ ] Sensitive data is handled securely
- [ ] Authentication/authorization is correct

### Testing

- [ ] Unit tests are present
- [ ] Integration tests are present (if applicable)
- [ ] Test coverage is adequate
- [ ] Tests are meaningful and not flaky

### Documentation

- [ ] Code is self-documenting
- [ ] Comments explain "why" not "what"
- [ ] README updated (if applicable)
- [ ] API documentation updated (if applicable)

## Review Notes

### Positive Feedback

- What was done well
- Good practices observed

### Suggestions for Improvement

- Area 1: Suggestion
- Area 2: Suggestion

### Critical Issues

- Issue 1: Description and impact
- Issue 2: Description and impact

## Action Items

- [ ] Action item 1
- [ ] Action item 2
- [ ] Action item 3

## Approval

- [ ] Approved
- [ ] Approved with minor changes
- [ ] Changes requested
- [ ] Rejected

**Reviewer Signature:** `Reviewer Name`  
**Date:** `YYYY-MM-DD`

---

**Template Instructions:**
1. Check all applicable items
2. Add specific notes and suggestions
3. Be constructive and specific
4. Include code examples for suggestions
5. Set clear action items
